text: Sir Peter Alexander Ustinov CBE FRSA (born Peter Alexander Baron von Ustinow; 16 April 1921 - 28 March 2004) was an English actor, filmmaker and writer. He portrayed lead roles in the movies Spartacus, Death on the Nile, Evil Under the Sun, Quo Vadis, and Topkaki. ==Early and personal life== Ustinov was born on 16 April 1921 in Swiss Cottage, London Borough of Camden. He studied at the Westminster School. He was married to Isolde Denham from 1940 until they divorced in 1950. He later married Suzanne Cloutier from 1954 until they divorced in 1971. He was then married to Helene de Lau d'Allemans from 1972 until his death in 2004. He lived in Bursins, Vaud, Switzerland and had three children. ==Death== Ustinov died on 28 March 2004 in Genolier, Vaud, Switzerland from heart failure, aged 82.Sir Peter Ustinov, President of the World Federalist Movement from 1991 to 2004, dies at age 82, World Federalist Movement, 29 March 2004. ==Awards== Ustinov won two Academy Awards, a Silver Bear Award, a BAFTA Award, three Emmy Awards, a Golden Globe Award, and a Grammy Award. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1921 births Category:2004 deaths Category:English Academy Award winning actors Category:Actors from London Category:BAFTA Award winning actors Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:English movie actors Category:English movie directors Category:English radio actors Category:English singers Category:English stage actors Category:English television actors Category:English voice actors Category:English writers Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:British Grammy Award winners Category:People educated at Westminster School, London Category:Singers from London Category:Writers from London
